comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: 1925 social note here finds James and Foster Blakely with parents Mr. and Mrs. William R. Hyde at Palm Beach for Easter: news.google.com/newspapers?id=lYUhAAAAIBAJ&sjid=gYwFA... 1938 article here mentions Foster Blakeley, Jim Blakeley, and their mother, Grace M. Hyde (Mrs. John W. Kiser): fultonhistory.com/newspaper%2011/New%20York%20Evening%20P... Jim (1910-2007) acted in films and became an executive at 20th Century Fox: www.imdb.com/name/nm0086769/ Jim was married in 1942 to actress Mary Carlisle (now age 101): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Carlisle Foster married (1947) and divorced (1948) Audrey Searle: news.google.com/newspapers?id=R9AdAAAAIBAJ&sjid=BSQEA... news.google.com/newspapers?id=NV0yAAAAIBAJ&sjid=jukFA... All three are listed as passengers on this 1922 voyage: www.ellisisland.org/shipping/FormatTripPass.asp?sship=Maj... James Blakeley has third billing in this 1937 movie, The Shadow Strikes: youtu.be/vHnCt7JA65A

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Related photo in the New-York tribune., December 21, 1915, Page 3 "ACTRESS, ZEPPELIN WIDOW, GETS HOME – Grace Riopelle's Husband, James Blakeley, Died from Shock as Bomb Burst."

comment._content: Per Tribune article, this is their arrival on December 20, 1915 in New York aboard the liner St. Paul.
